kj8twn8wText:
*Side effects associated with Brintellix® were compared with those of the SSRIs escitalopram and paroxetine and with those of the SNRI Venlafaxine.
**For the 20 mg/day dose, an increase in treatment-emergent sexual dysfunction was seen compared to placebo. Please refer to the full Summary of Product
Characteristics or Prescribing Information for further information on safety and tolerability.
kj8twn8xText:
Brintellix® does not exhibit many of the side
effects typical of SSRIs and SNRIs* including
sexual dysfunction** and weight gain1-4
kj8twn97Text: Low rate of treatment
kj8twn9bText: Low rate of safety-related
kj8twn9dText: ComparisonGenerally well tolerated
Brintellix_55928e5e66: Brintellix® had no effect relative to placebo on body weight in clinical short- and long-term studies1
Brintellix_5557caf76e:
Mean weight increase in patients treated with Brintellix® for up to
12 months1
Brintellix_554cf64ad9: From an analysis designed to assess the tolerability and safety in Brintellix® in 11 randomised, double-blind, placebo-controlled, short-term studies in MDD and five long-term studies. Ten of the short-term studies included participants aged 18-75, and one included only participants aged over 65.  1. Baldwin DS et al. J Psychopharmacol 2016;30:242-252.

Less than 1kg
weight changes

discontinuation symptoms

Brintellix_55970c6085:
From an analysis designed to assess the tolerability and safety in Brintellix® in 1.1 randomised, double-blind placebo-controlled short-term studies.
Duloxetine and venlafaxine were included as active references for study validation, not for comparison of effect size. ATPS, all patients treated set. 1. Baldwin DS et al. J Psychopharmacol 2016;30:242-252.
Brintellix_554c9b1d58: Incidence of treatment-emergent sexual dysfunction with Brintellix® is at placebo level†1
Brintellix_5565f4818a:
Sexual dysfunction is an underreported yet important adverse effect of antidepressants,2
occurring in up to 71% of patients3 and accounting for up to 22% of treatment
discontinuations4
Brintellix_55cfb9e427:
In the MDD 6-8 week controlled trials of Brintellix®, spontaneous reported adverse
reactions related to sexual dysfunction were captured as individual event terms5
Brintellix_55f189ab5e:
†For the 20 mg/day dose, an increase in TESD was seen compared to placebo. TESD, treatment-emergent sexual dysfunction.

1. Brintellix® Summary of Product Characteristics. 2021. 2. Llorca PM et al. Curr MedRes Opin 2014;30:12,2589-2606. 3. Clayton AH et al. Expert Opin Drug Saf 2014;13:1361-1374. 4. Thase ME et al. Eur Neuropsychopharmacol 2017;27:773-781. 5. Trintellix® US Prescribing Information.
Brintellix_5510ca87ce: Brintellix® maintains efficacy in treating MDD while improving SSRI-induced sexual dysfunction,*3 and is weight neutral**1,4
Brintellix_55a7d52822: Sexual dysfunction
Brintellix_558fcdf60c: Efficacy compared to Escitalopram
Brintellix_557a9fc24a: Mean change from baseline in CSFQ-14
Brintellix_5527895788: Brintellix® is superior to escitalopram at improving SSRI induced TESD*3
Brintellix_55251fd35d:
Mean change from baseline
in CSFQ-14 total score
Brintellix_557435dff7: Weeks in study
Brintellix_55db364b31: *As measured by CSFQ-14. Previous SSRIs included citalopram, paroxetine or sertraline. In short-term clinical studies, the 20 mg dose of Brintellix® was associated with an increase in treatment-emergent sexual dysfunction;4 **Relative to placebo, in clinical short and long-term studies; †p<0.05; ‡p<0.01 vs. escitalopram. The primary endpoint in Jacobsen PL et al. (2015) was change from baseline in the CSFQ-14 total score after eight weeks of treatment. A further endpoint included change from baseline in MADRS total score. The severity of depressive symptoms for both Brintellix®-treated and escitalopram-treated patients remained low (as measured by MADRS).Mean change from baseline in (CSFO-14) total scores during the double-blind treatment period. MMRM, FAS, LS means. CSFQ-14, changes in sexual functioning questionnaire - short form; (sexual pleasure, sexual desire/frequency, sexual desire/interest, sexual arousal, sexual orgasm); FAS, full analysis set; MADRS, Montgomery-Asberg depression rating scale; MMRM, mixed model for repeated measures; LS means, least square means. 1. Baldwin DS et al. J Psychopharmacol 2016;30:242-252. 2. Brintellix® Summary of Product Characteristics. 2021. 3. Jacobsen PL et al. J Sex Med 2015;12:2036-2048. 4. Alvarez E et al. Int J Neuropsychopharmacol 2012;15:589-600.
Brintellix_55c917b5a3:
Vortioxetine was superior to escitalopram in improving SSRI-induced treatment-
emergent sexual dysfunction while efficacy measured with MADRS was maintained

Mean change from baseline
in MADRS total score
Brintellix_55fb8cc99e: Weeks
Brintellix_558a8b926f:
The study included well-treated patients with MDD who were in remission for depressive symptoms but were experiencing sexual dysfunction
while being treated with citalopram, sertraline or paroxetine
1. Baldwin DS et al. J Psychopharmacol 2016;30:242-252. 2. Brintellix® Summary of Product Characteristics. 2021. 3. Jacobsen PL et al. J Sex Med 2015;12:2036-2048. 4. Alvarez E et al. Int J Neuropsychopharmacol 2012;15:589-600.
Brintellix_552eccd598: Brintellix® sleep disturbance at placebo level in short term and long term clinical trials1
Brintellix_551d1c6290: Brintellix® is not associated with sleep disturbance above placebo level1
Brintellix_55d903e01c: Brintellix® is not associated with insomnia/fatigue in short term and long term clinical trials1
Brintellix_553af9a386: 1. Brintellix® Summary of Product Characteristics. 2021.
Brintellix_558387db39: Mild to moderate nausea
Brintellix_5569c3a965: It typically occurs within the first two weeks, is usually transient and does not generally lead to treatment discontinuation1,2
Brintellix_557b122b8a: Nausea is the most common adverse event1,2
Brintellix_55238d71cd:
The incidence of
nausea associated
with Brintellix® was
dose-dependent2
Brintellix_55a08d9662: 1. Brintellix® Summary of Product Characteristics. 2021. 2. Baldwin DS et al. J Psychopharmacol 2016;30:242-252.
Brintellix_55190db974:
In clinical studies, Brintellix® had no clinically
significant effect relative to placebo on hepatic or
renal assessments, heart rate or blood pressure1
Brintellix® has not shown any clinically significant
effect on ECG parameters1,2
Brintellix_55eb25ca7e:
Including QT, QTc, PR and QRS intervals
QTc interval prolongation has not been
observed in healthy subjects exposed to up to
40 mg daily
Brintellix_55043b6017:
*Brintellix® 5 mg-20 mg is the approved dose range for the treatment of adult patients with MDD.
1. Brintellix® Summary of Product Characteristics. 2021. 2. Wang Y et al. Clin Pharmacol Drug Devel 2013;2:298-309.
Brintellix_5563bf753f:
Ingestion of Brintellix® in the dose range of 40 mg
to 75 mg has caused an aggravation of the following
adverse reactions: nausea, postural dizziness,
diarrhoea, abdominal discomfort, generalised
pruritus, somnolence and flushing*1
Brintellix_55a3c9414c: Safety-related adverse events
Brintellix_55eb1b6fc6:
TEAEs with an incidence of ≥5% in any group during the core
treatment period (APTS) in 11 short-term MDD studies1
Brintellix_552a389f82: Preferred Term
Brintellix_55980f9a91:
% values in bold are ≥5% and >2x placebo. *Includes the preferred terms: insomnia, initial insomnia, middle insomnia, hyposomnia, sleep disorder, dyssomnia, poor quality sleep and terminal insomnia; **Includes the preferred terms: libido decreased, ejaculation delayed, ejaculation disorder, orgasm abnormal, anorgasmia, disturbance in sexual arousal, ejaculation failure, erectile dysfunction, loss of libido, orgasmic sensation decreased, sexual dysfunction, and vulvovaginal dryness. APTS, all patients treated set; MDD, major depressive disorder; PYE, patient-years of exposure; TEAE, treatment-emergent adverse event.
1. Baldwin DS et al. J Psychopharmacol 2016;30:242-252.
Brintellix_55c1f28f35: Drug-drug interactions
Brintellix_55c5b82600:
Brintellix® has a low potential for drug-drug interactions
and can be used with many common drugs, including:1
Brintellix_55bdc37d6f: 1. Brintellix® Summary of Product Characteristics. 2021.
Brintellix_55020fce9e:
A dose adjustment of Brintellix® may be considered
if a broad cytochrome P450 inducer (e.g. rifampicin,
carbamazepine, phenytoin) is added to Brintellix®
treatment1
A dose reduction of Brintellix® may be considered if
a strong CYP2D6 inhibitor (e.g. bupropion, quinidine,
fluoxetine, paroxetine) is added to Brintellix® treatment1
 Concomitant use with non-selective monoamine oxidase
inhibitors (MAOIs) or selective MAO-A inhibitors
is contraindicated1
Brintellix_557c842312:
Warfarin and Aspirin
Diazepam
Combined oral contraceptives (ethinylestradiol 30 µg/levonorgestrel 150 µg)
